column4:
In the middle of a pandemic I‚Äôd like to hear the President talk just a little less about Joe Biden and a little more about his health care plan.

What healthcare plan, you ask?

Me too.
RT @ASP: . @jahimes explains the QAnon conspiracy theory, its roots in violence and racism, and the reason why he thinks President Trump re‚Ä¶
RT @molly_knight: ‚ÄúSorry you‚Äôre getting evicted because of the pandemic. Please enjoy my new Supreme Court Justice who will also take away‚Ä¶

Mr. President - I'm glad that you are improving. Your time at Walter Reed shows that quality medical care saves lives. 

So now that taxpayer-funded healthcare saved you, can you please drop your lawsuit to take away the healthcare of 20 million Americans? https://t.co/EWzmvY73eH
@KateNocera ‚ÄúIf airplane safety videos have taught me anything, David, it's that a mother puts her own mask on first.‚Äù
@LEBassett If airplane safety videos have taught me anything, David, it's that a mother puts her own mask on first.

Got word that my colleague and neighbor @RepJahanaHayes tested positive for #COVID 

Praying for a speedy and smooth recovery for her.

Be extra safe out there, friends.
RT @jaredpolis: Conspiracy theories are a real danger to civil society. It‚Äôs hard to bridge the divide on opinions if we can‚Äôt even agree o‚Ä¶

2020 has been a really tough year. So it‚Äôs been a huge relief these last two nights to learn that Covid has been licked, the economy is roaring and peace has been achieved in the Middle East.
#RepublicanConvention2020
If the President was 10% as concerned with the 150,000 Americans dead of Coronavirus as he is with vandalism in Portland, there would be a lot fewer than 150,000 Americans dead of Coronavirus.

There's also a guy down my street who keeps knocking over trash cans at night. Can you help??

Or, you know, focus on the pandemic that's killed 130,000 Americans? And maybe say something to the Russians who may be putting hits on our troops?

Just a thought. https://t.co/XNlD8Tg5EY

RT @NormEisen: Trump wants to rip millions of Americans health care away.  In the middle of a pandemic.

His administration is saying so in‚Ä¶

@tjcurt Thousands of people covered with health insurance because of ACA. Financial meltdown behind us because of ARRA, and Dodd Frank. Rebuilding Walk Bridge, rebuilding Congress St Bridge, fed funds for urban Transitway, Norwalk pulsepoint. Out of characters, but there‚Äôs more....

@the_mjs That‚Äôs not what I‚Äôm saying at all. You‚Äôre engaging in sophistry. I‚Äôm pointing out that mental health is not the driving explanation of our massive gun violence problem, as you suggest it is. And I suggest you read the Heller decision of SCOTUS before opining on constitutionality.
@the_mjs Show me the data that we have much more severe mental health issues than Japan, the UK, Germany or Canada, where gun deaths are a fraction of ours and I‚Äôll dig into that.

Morad Tahbaz, my constituent, has been unjustly held by Iran for years. He is vulnerable and in failing health. I have asked @JZarif for a humanitarian release over and over again. Now is the time. https://t.co/lvELT88bWO

Dropped by Greater Bridgeport Transit today to see all they are doing to keep buses and vans safe. Barriers, distancing and sanitizing.

If you ride, please wear a mask. https://t.co/NAQcaMVsQY
@ChkShove And Grennell declassified unmasking information, not FISA stuff, proving absolutely nothing other than that lots of people were concerned with the many Trump-Russia ties. For good reason.
The House is back in session. Headed to DC. Here‚Äôs my train. Probably good for health, but not for Amtrak. https://t.co/zYJWTvJNm4

Always shocked when ancient virtues need to be explained to so called ‚Äúconservatives‚Äù.

Courage is risk taken for the benefit of others. Risk taken for self-aggrandizement is hubris or vanity. It is punished by the gods.

We wear masks for others. https://t.co/FMld0J7hX2

Was so moved this morning to (safely) meet the Rev. Patrick Collins of Old Greenwich First Congregational Church. He is placing a flag for every person in Connecticut lost to #COVID19

Today he went through 3,000. https://t.co/ed3xb0sA82

Want to hear from a Himes who has charisma, skills and facts for a change?!?!

Join me 4pm this afternoon for a Facebook Live chat with my sister, Dr. Katherine Himes, who will give us a look inside her hospital in Pittsburgh and drop some knowledge.

https://t.co/qT5HUOyxM3

Seventeen words that perfectly summarize a presidency:

 ‚Äú‚ÄòNow, the one thing that the pandemic has taught us is that I was right,‚Äô Trump said. @post #CV19
We crossed the 2,000 #COVID19 fatalities mark in Connecticut today. It‚Äôs impossible to imagine the pain that has been visited on so many of our friends and neighbors.
Hand sanitizer, gloves, masks and voting cards outside the House Chamber as we prepare to pass the aid bill. https://t.co/V59eHcUKT6
On the House Floor right now to support the expansion of PPP and $ for our hospitals/testing.  Very eerie. Everyone in masks. People spread 10 feet apart. https://t.co/DxJFB6FjDH

@Nisha_Arora Wow. Bridgeport has been devastated by 1,300 positive cases of CV-19 and disproportionate fatalities. Many of its citizens don‚Äôt have jobs that allow them to stay home. Maybe not the best time to say that its people are less thoughtful than you are.

Delivered food, coffee and deep gratitude (safely) to these firefighters in #Bridgeport and #Norwalk. Some people can‚Äôt work from home to keep you safe. @norwalkctfire @BridgeportFire 

Do the right thing so that they can stay safe and healthy. https://t.co/jRg4lmV39F

Michael Sandel: ‚ÄúMobilizing to confront the pandemic and, eventually, to reconstruct the shattered economy, requires not only medical and economic expertise but moral and political renewal.‚Äù https://t.co/Hzxyni4LBQ

At some point this weekend, the United States will become the country with the most #coronavirus deaths in the world.

Time to double down on keeping away from each other, washing our hands, and looking out for the vulnerable. #COVID„Éº19
@grnojne The fact that your COVID fatality numbers are low by a factor of 4 is the least dumb thing about your tweet.

Ok. Apparently I just did my official Facebook Live on Coronavirus out of my personal Facebook page. Did not imagine I would spend Easter weekend being mercilessly attacked by my college roommates, but here we go....

My little sis is a doc in Pittsburgh, tough as nails. She just reached out: ‚ÄúI have always handled crises in hospital, but this is hard.‚Äù

We don‚Äôt ask for help in the Himes family. I know, not recommending that.

Don‚Äôt close today w/out supporting a bunch of people. #COVID2019

@JohnOgd13702236 @realDonaldTrump Hey John! Personal attacks are a sign of weak argument and probably character. Second, I‚Äôve been home, as instructed, working 20 hour days to get information out, secure PPE for my hospitals, and support our first responders. What have you been doing other than spreading poison?

For the rest of our lives, each of us will carry around the question: when my people were dying, did I do enough?

Be like Mario. 

#COVID19 #coronavirus  https://t.co/pp5YL8jK8y
